summary: The 'Aaron Salter, Jr., Responsible Body Armor Possession Act' prohibits civilians from purchasing, owning, or possessing enhanced body armor (armor exceeding RF1 standards), with exceptions for government entities, law enforcement officers (including corrections officers), and armor lawfully possessed before the law's enactment. It amends U.S. Code Title 18, Chapter 44, Section 935 to define the prohibition and penalties, including fines and imprisonment up to 5 years for violations. The bill defines “enhanced body armor” according to NIJ standards.
